html.p: Most inputs require an Azure AD App Registration to authenticate to Azure. An Azure AD App Registration is similar to a username and password, except an Azure AD App Registration has a client ID and client secret.

ul.li: Instructions for creating an Azure AD App Registration can be found here.

html.p: The Azure AD App Registration must be granted necessary permissions in order to retrieve the necessary data. Most inputs only require Reader access to the subscription; however, some inputs will require additional API permissions.

ul.li: Refer to this document for specific permissions required for each input in this add-on and others.

html.p: After creating the Azure AD App Registration, enter the Client ID and Client Secret in the Configuration section of this add-on.
The Event Hub input has been deprecated in this add-on. Please use the Splunk supported Splunk Add-on for Microsoft Cloud Services to ingest Event Hub data.

The Event Hub input does not use an Azure Active Directory Application Registration. Instead, the Event Hub input connects directly to an Azure Event Hub using a connection string. The connection string is stored encrypted on the local Splunk instance.
Refer to the Event Hub Input Setup page for specific directions.

Several troubleshooting views have been included:
The View Checkpoints view allows you to see the current checkpoint value for each input. Inputs use checkpoints to page through data. The checkpoint value may be a date/time, or a cursor string returned from an API.
The View Debug Logs view shows debug events specific to the add-on inputs. Ensure the add-on log level is set to DEBUG by navigating to Configuration > Logging > Log level.
The View Error Logs view will help troubleshoot errors.
Additional help can be found on Splunk Answers.
